definition: to visit a patient at home (of a doctor)/house call

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Worker do sth without authorization asks all fee of doctor pay a home visit all provide for oneself by him worker.
sentences.chinese: 職工擅自請醫生出診的一切費用，均由職工本人自理。

sentences.english: The doctor is visiting a patient now.
Doctors don´t much like being called out at night．
sentences.chinese: 醫生們不太喜歡夜間出診。

sentences.english: In the old days we got a visit from the vet maybe once a year.
sentences.chinese: 以前，獸醫大概每年來我們這裏出診一次。

sentences.english: The doctor is often called away at night.
sentences.chinese: 這位大夫經常夜裏被請去出診。

sentences.english: The doctor is on his round of visits.
Dr. Hale is on call at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 黑爾醫生在醫院裏等待出診。

sentences.english: The doctor attended a professional call.
sentences.chinese: 醫生應患者的請求去出診。

sentences.english: The doctor visits his patients at their homes at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 那醫生定期到病人家出診。

definition: consultation (medical)/to meet for diagnosis/(by extension) consultation of different specialists
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
waiting to see a doctor/awaiting treatment
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
to receive hospital treatment/to be hospitalized
see 體格檢查|体格检查[ti3 ge2 jian3 cha2]
